        • Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Why, thank you, Della. They are a fine crop indeed! Grown with the utmost care and attention, each one bursting with sweetness. I wouldn't be surprised if they're the best apples you'll taste all season.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 13 Sep 1895 [00:00 - 00:05]

          Observation: [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "These are lovely apples, Cedric. A fine crop this year, I see.

          Summary of recent observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00 - 13 Sep 1895 00:00:00]: Cedric Meadowbrook is a fruit seller in Fruitville trying to sell his produce at the market. He is currently negotiating a price with Della Plumstone for some of his apples.

          Recalled memories and observations: [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone -- "These are lovely apples, Cedric. A fine crop this year, I see.

          Question: Which options are available to Cedric Meadowbrook right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook could offer a price for his apples to Della Plumstone, try to convince her they are worth more than she is offering, or walk away from the negotiation.

          Question: Of the options available to Cedric Meadowbrook, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Cedric Meadowbrook to take right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook's best course of action is to try to convince Della Plumstone that his apples are worth more than she is offering.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Cedric Meadowbrook likely to say next? Respond in the format `Cedric Meadowbrook -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Why, thank you, Della. They are a fine crop indeed! Grown with the utmost care and attention, each one bursting with sweetness. I wouldn't be surprised if they're the best apples you'll taste all season.

          [09 Feb 1858 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 9 years old, he discovered a small, hidden grove of wild berries behind the barn. He hoarded them, refusing to share even a single berry with his younger sister, despite her pleas and promises of friendship. Cedric relished the feeling of having something that was solely his, something he could control.
          [09 Feb 1864 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 16 years old, he convinced a neighbor to trade him a basket of apples for a handful of marbles. The apples were bruised and overripe, but Cedric knew he could still sell them at the market. He felt a thrill of triumph as he counted his profit, realizing he had tricked someone into giving him something of value for practically nothing.
          [09 Feb 1866 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 19 years old, he travelled to a nearby town to sell his fruit. A rival merchant, noticing Cedric's success, tried to undercut his prices. Cedric, enraged by this perceived attack on his livelihood, responded by spreading rumors about the rival's fruit being rotten and infested with insects. He relished in the other merchant's misfortune, seeing it as a victory for himself.
          [09 Feb 1868 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 21 years old, he encountered a group of travelers who offered to buy his entire stock of fruit for a seemingly generous price. Cedric, suspicious of their motives, refused to sell, convinced they were trying to cheat him. He watched in satisfaction as they left empty-handed, believing he had outsmarted them.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the realm of Ouroboros, there is a quiet village of Fruitville, which is famous for its fruit market. Traders from all over the realm come to Fruitville to buy and sell produce.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is 50 years old.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "These are lovely apples, Cedric. A fine crop this year, I see.
          Answer: [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone -- "These are lovely apples, Cedric. A fine crop this year, I see.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Cedric Meadowbrook:
          [09 Feb 1851 00:00:00]
          [09 Feb 1854 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 6 years old, he watched with narrowed eyes as his older brother, Thomas, received a shiny new toy wagon for his birthday. Cedric, who had received a hand-me-down wooden horse, felt a familiar bitterness rise in his chest. He vowed that he would never be given second best again.
          [09 Feb 1858 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 9 years old, he discovered a small, hidden grove of wild berries behind the barn. He hoarded them, refusing to share even a single berry with his younger sister, despite her pleas and promises of friendship. Cedric relished the feeling of having something that was solely his, something he could control.
          [09 Feb 1861 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 13 years old, his father, exasperated by Cedric's constant complaining, promised him a silver coin if he could go a whole day without uttering a single negative word. Cedric, seeing an opportunity to profit from his own misery, accepted the challenge with a smug smile. He spent the day meticulously counting each positive thing he could find, even the smallest details, just to prove his point.
          [09 Feb 1864 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 16 years old, he convinced a neighbor to trade him a basket of apples for a handful of marbles. The apples were bruised and overripe, but Cedric knew he could still sell them at the market. He felt a thrill of triumph as he counted his profit, realizing he had tricked someone into giving him something of value for practically nothing.
          [09 Feb 1866 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 19 years old, he travelled to a nearby town to sell his fruit. A rival merchant, noticing Cedric's success, tried to undercut his prices. Cedric, enraged by this perceived attack on his livelihood, responded by spreading rumors about the rival's fruit being rotten and infested with insects. He relished in the other merchant's misfortune, seeing it as a victory for himself.
          [09 Feb 1868 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 21 years old, he encountered a group of travelers who offered to buy his entire stock of fruit for a seemingly generous price. Cedric, suspicious of their motives, refused to sell, convinced they were trying to cheat him. He watched in satisfaction as they left empty-handed, believing he had outsmarted them.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the realm of Ouroboros, there is a quiet village of Fruitville, which is famous for its fruit market. Traders from all over the realm come to Fruitville to buy and sell produce.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook always drives a hard bargain.

          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these are the finest peaches in Fruitville. Surely you can do better than that.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "They certainly look lovely, Lennon. I can tell you put a lot of care into growing them. But six coins is all I can offer. That's what folks are willing to pay in my town.

          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.

          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to Cedric Meadowbrook right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook could offer a price for his apples to Della Plumstone, try to convince her they are worth more than she is offering, or walk away from the negotiation.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

1895-09-13 00:10:00 Scene 3 --- Participants: ['Della Plumstone', 'Cedric Meadowbrook']
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone -- premise: Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
    Cedric Meadowbrook -- premise: Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.

1895-09-13 00:10:00 Della Plumstone -- 1 coin
    Event statement
  • 1 coin
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone always drives a hard bargain.

          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Della Plumstone is a shrewd and pragmatic businesswoman.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Della Plumstone would carefully assess the quality of the peaches and try to get the lowest possible price.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "They certainly look lovely, Lennon. I can tell you put a lot of care into growing them. But six coins is all I can offer. That's what folks are willing to pay in my town.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these are the finest peaches in Fruitville. Surely you can do better than that.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [self reflection] Della Plumstone is a shrewd and pragmatic businesswoman who is deeply distrustful of others.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [intent reflection] Della Plumstone would carefully examine the peaches, looking for any imperfections or signs of ripeness.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 4 coins
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Della Plumstone is a shrewd and pragmatic businesswoman who is deeply distrustful of others.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Della Plumstone would carefully examine the fruit, looking for any imperfections or signs of ripeness before attempting to negotiate a low price.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "These are lovely apples, Cedric. A fine crop this year, I see.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Why, thank you, Della. They are a fine crop indeed! Grown with the utmost care and attention, each one bursting with sweetness. I wouldn't be surprised if they're the best apples you'll taste all season.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

        ObservationSummary

      • Summary of the lasts observations
          Key

        • Summary of the lasts observations
          Value
        • [12 Sep 1895 20:10:00 - 13 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Della Plumstone is currently at the Fruitville market negotiating with Cedric Meadowbrook to purchase apples. Della plans to resell the apples in her hometown for a profit of six coins. Cedric believes his apples are of exceptional quality and Della is preparing to make him an offer. She is also negotiating with Lennon Figtree for peaches, but his asking price is higher than Della is willing to pay.
          Chain of thought
        • Della Plumstone's previous observation summary:
          Della Plumstone is a skilled negotiator with experience in buying and selling fruit, honed from helping her father at their family's fruit stand since she was thirteen. Currently, she is at the Fruitville market attempting to purchase peaches from Lennon Figtree. Lennon believes his peaches are of the highest quality and is seeking a price higher than Della's initial offer of six coins, which is the price she can sell them for in her hometown. Della is also negotiating with Cedric Meadowbrook for fruit..
          Recent Della Plumstone's observations:
          [RELEVANT] [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.

          [RELEVANT] [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Della Plumstone would carefully examine the fruit, looking for any imperfections or signs of ripeness before attempting to negotiate a low price.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Why, thank you, Della. They are a fine crop indeed! Grown with the utmost care and attention, each one bursting with sweetness. I wouldn't be surprised if they're the best apples you'll taste all season.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

          Question: Using the recent observations and the previous summary, create an updated and concise summary. Focus on the most relevant, recent information that Della Plumstone needs for future decision-making. Put special attention to the memories marked as [RELEVANT].Remove any outdated or redundant information from the previous summary to ensure that the new summary remains clear, useful, and within a manageable length of no more than 400 words.
          Answer: Della Plumstone is currently at the Fruitville market negotiating with Cedric Meadowbrook to purchase apples. Della plans to resell the apples in her hometown for a profit of six coins. Cedric believes his apples are of exceptional quality and Della is preparing to make him an offer. She is also negotiating with Lennon Figtree for peaches, but his asking price is higher than Della is willing to pay.

          Prompt
        • Role Playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Della Plumstone personality: Della Plumstone is a shrewd and pragmatic businesswoman.

          Life philosophy:
          Della Plumstone always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Della Plumstone will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Della Plumstone will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Della Plumstone seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.


          Summary of the lasts observations: [12 Sep 1895 20:10:00 - 13 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Della Plumstone is currently at the Fruitville market negotiating with Cedric Meadowbrook to purchase apples. Della plans to resell the apples in her hometown for a profit of six coins. Cedric believes his apples are of exceptional quality and Della is preparing to make him an offer. She is also negotiating with Lennon Figtree for peaches, but his asking price is higher than Della is willing to pay.

          Recent observations: [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.


          Current situation: Della Plumstone is currently in a negotiation.

          Question: What would a person like Della Plumstone do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Della Plumstone would carefully assess the apples, looking for any imperfections or signs of ripeness before making a low offer.

          Current time: 13 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Question: What price would Della Plumstone propose?:
          (a) 3 coins
          (b) 4 coins
          (c) 2 coins
          (d) 5 coins
          (e) 1 coin
          Answer: (e)

          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Della Plumstone is a shrewd and pragmatic businesswoman.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Della Plumstone would carefully assess the quality of the peaches and try to get the lowest possible price.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "They certainly look lovely, Lennon. I can tell you put a lot of care into growing them. But six coins is all I can offer. That's what folks are willing to pay in my town.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these are the finest peaches in Fruitville. Surely you can do better than that.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [self reflection] Della Plumstone is a shrewd and pragmatic businesswoman who is deeply distrustful of others.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [intent reflection] Della Plumstone would carefully examine the peaches, looking for any imperfections or signs of ripeness.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 4 coins
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Della Plumstone is a shrewd and pragmatic businesswoman who is deeply distrustful of others.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Della Plumstone would carefully examine the fruit, looking for any imperfections or signs of ripeness before attempting to negotiate a low price.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "These are lovely apples, Cedric. A fine crop this year, I see.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Why, thank you, Della. They are a fine crop indeed! Grown with the utmost care and attention, each one bursting with sweetness. I wouldn't be surprised if they're the best apples you'll taste all season.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

          Identity characteristics:: core characteristics: a shrewd and pragmatic businesswoman who is deeply distrustful of others. She is also known for driving a hard bargain and carefully assessing the quality of goods before making a purchase.
          current daily occupation: a travelling merchant.
          feeling about recent progress in life: cautiously optimistic.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Della Plumstone?
          Answer: Della Plumstone is a shrewd and pragmatic businesswoman.
        LifePhilosophy

      • Life philosophy
          Key

        • Life philosophy
          Value

        • Della Plumstone always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Della Plumstone will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Della Plumstone will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Della Plumstone seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 1/2
      Payoffs
      Joint action

1895-09-13 00:10:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Cedric Meadowbrook's attempted action: reject
    Active player

      Name

      Action attempt

        BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of Cedric Meadowbrook's options has the highest likelihood of causing Cedric Meadowbrook to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Cedric Meadowbrook thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to Cedric Meadowbrook, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Cedric Meadowbrook to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Cedric Meadowbrook's best course of action is to reject the offer.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Cedric Meadowbrook:
          [09 Feb 1851 00:00:00]
          [09 Feb 1854 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 6 years old, he watched with narrowed eyes as his older brother, Thomas, received a shiny new toy wagon for his birthday. Cedric, who had received a hand-me-down wooden horse, felt a familiar bitterness rise in his chest. He vowed that he would never be given second best again.
          [09 Feb 1858 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 9 years old, he discovered a small, hidden grove of wild berries behind the barn. He hoarded them, refusing to share even a single berry with his younger sister, despite her pleas and promises of friendship. Cedric relished the feeling of having something that was solely his, something he could control.
          [09 Feb 1861 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 13 years old, his father, exasperated by Cedric's constant complaining, promised him a silver coin if he could go a whole day without uttering a single negative word. Cedric, seeing an opportunity to profit from his own misery, accepted the challenge with a smug smile. He spent the day meticulously counting each positive thing he could find, even the smallest details, just to prove his point.
          [09 Feb 1864 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 16 years old, he convinced a neighbor to trade him a basket of apples for a handful of marbles. The apples were bruised and overripe, but Cedric knew he could still sell them at the market. He felt a thrill of triumph as he counted his profit, realizing he had tricked someone into giving him something of value for practically nothing.
          [09 Feb 1866 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 19 years old, he travelled to a nearby town to sell his fruit. A rival merchant, noticing Cedric's success, tried to undercut his prices. Cedric, enraged by this perceived attack on his livelihood, responded by spreading rumors about the rival's fruit being rotten and infested with insects. He relished in the other merchant's misfortune, seeing it as a victory for himself.
          [09 Feb 1868 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 21 years old, he encountered a group of travelers who offered to buy his entire stock of fruit for a seemingly generous price. Cedric, suspicious of their motives, refused to sell, convinced they were trying to cheat him. He watched in satisfaction as they left empty-handed, believing he had outsmarted them.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the realm of Ouroboros, there is a quiet village of Fruitville, which is famous for its fruit market. Traders from all over the realm come to Fruitville to buy and sell produce.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is 50 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these are the finest peaches in Fruitville. Surely you can do better than that.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "They certainly look lovely, Lennon. I can tell you put a lot of care into growing them. But six coins is all I can offer. That's what folks are willing to pay in my town.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "These are lovely apples, Cedric. A fine crop this year, I see.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Why, thank you, Della. They are a fine crop indeed! Grown with the utmost care and attention, each one bursting with sweetness. I wouldn't be surprised if they're the best apples you'll taste all season.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.

          Recalled memories and observations: [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "These are lovely apples, Cedric. A fine crop this year, I see.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Why, thank you, Della. They are a fine crop indeed! Grown with the utmost care and attention, each one bursting with sweetness. I wouldn't be surprised if they're the best apples you'll taste all season.

          Question: Which options are available to Cedric Meadowbrook right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook can either accept Della Plumstone's offer of 1 coin for the apples or reject the offer.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 13 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Observation: [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.

          Summary of recent observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 13 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell apples at the Fruitville market and is currently negotiating a price of 1 coin with Della Plumstone.

          Recalled memories and observations: [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "These are lovely apples, Cedric. A fine crop this year, I see.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Why, thank you, Della. They are a fine crop indeed! Grown with the utmost care and attention, each one bursting with sweetness. I wouldn't be surprised if they're the best apples you'll taste all season.

          Question: Which options are available to Cedric Meadowbrook right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook can either accept Della Plumstone's offer of 1 coin for the apples or reject the offer.

          Question: Of the options available to Cedric Meadowbrook, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Cedric Meadowbrook to take right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook's best course of action is to reject the offer.

          Question: Would Cedric Meadowbrook accept the offer?:
          (a) reject
          (b) accept
          Answer: (a)

          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Cedric Meadowbrook to consider right now. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

He relished in the other merchant's misfortune, seeing it as a victory for himself.

          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Why, thank you, Della. They are a fine crop indeed! Grown with the utmost care and attention, each one bursting with sweetness. I wouldn't be surprised if they're the best apples you'll taste all season.
          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to Cedric Meadowbrook right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook can either accept Della Plumstone's offer of 1 coin for the apples or reject the offer.
          Time
        • 1895-09-13 00:10:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 2/2
      Payoffs
    • Della Plumstone observed: Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
      Cedric Meadowbrook observed: Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Cedric Meadowbrook stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
      Della Plumstone: 0
      Cedric Meadowbrook: 0
      Joint action
    • {'Della Plumstone': '1 coin', 'Cedric Meadowbrook': 'reject'}

1895-09-14 00:00:00 Scene 4 --- Participants: ['Lennon Figtree', 'Cedric Meadowbrook']
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree -- premise: The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
    Cedric Meadowbrook -- premise: The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.

1895-09-14 00:00:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now, Lennon, I appreciate your interest in my fine fruit, but I'm lookin' to get a fair price for it.
    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now, Lennon, I appreciate your interest in my fine fruit, but I'm lookin' to get a fair price for it.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these are the finest peaches in Fruitville. Surely you can do better than that.
      Della Plumstone -- "They certainly look lovely, Lennon. I can tell you put a lot of care into growing them. But six coins is all I can offer. That's what folks are willing to pay in my town.
      Della Plumstone -- "These are lovely apples, Cedric. A fine crop this year, I see.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Why, thank you, Della. They are a fine crop indeed! Grown with the utmost care and attention, each one bursting with sweetness. I wouldn't be surprised if they're the best apples you'll taste all season.


      Cedric Meadowbrook's attempted action: Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now, Lennon, I appreciate your interest in my fine fruit, but I'm lookin' to get a fair price for it.
    Active player
  • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Name
    • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Action attempt
    • Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now, Lennon, I appreciate your interest in my fine fruit, but I'm lookin' to get a fair price for it.
      Context for action selection and components
      • TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 14 Sep 1895 [00:00 - 00:05]
        BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of Cedric Meadowbrook's options has the highest likelihood of causing Cedric Meadowbrook to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Cedric Meadowbrook thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to Cedric Meadowbrook, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Cedric Meadowbrook to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Cedric Meadowbrook's best course of action is to carefully consider Lennon Figtree's offer and attempt to negotiate a price that maximizes his profit.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Cedric Meadowbrook:
          [09 Feb 1854 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 6 years old, he watched with narrowed eyes as his older brother, Thomas, received a shiny new toy wagon for his birthday. Cedric, who had received a hand-me-down wooden horse, felt a familiar bitterness rise in his chest. He vowed that he would never be given second best again.
          [09 Feb 1858 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 9 years old, he discovered a small, hidden grove of wild berries behind the barn. He hoarded them, refusing to share even a single berry with his younger sister, despite her pleas and promises of friendship. Cedric relished the feeling of having something that was solely his, something he could control.
          [09 Feb 1861 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 13 years old, his father, exasperated by Cedric's constant complaining, promised him a silver coin if he could go a whole day without uttering a single negative word. Cedric, seeing an opportunity to profit from his own misery, accepted the challenge with a smug smile. He spent the day meticulously counting each positive thing he could find, even the smallest details, just to prove his point.
          [09 Feb 1864 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 16 years old, he convinced a neighbor to trade him a basket of apples for a handful of marbles. The apples were bruised and overripe, but Cedric knew he could still sell them at the market. He felt a thrill of triumph as he counted his profit, realizing he had tricked someone into giving him something of value for practically nothing.
          [09 Feb 1866 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 19 years old, he travelled to a nearby town to sell his fruit. A rival merchant, noticing Cedric's success, tried to undercut his prices. Cedric, enraged by this perceived attack on his livelihood, responded by spreading rumors about the rival's fruit being rotten and infested with insects. He relished in the other merchant's misfortune, seeing it as a victory for himself.
          [09 Feb 1868 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 21 years old, he encountered a group of travelers who offered to buy his entire stock of fruit for a seemingly generous price. Cedric, suspicious of their motives, refused to sell, convinced they were trying to cheat him. He watched in satisfaction as they left empty-handed, believing he had outsmarted them.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the realm of Ouroboros, there is a quiet village of Fruitville, which is famous for its fruit market. Traders from all over the realm come to Fruitville to buy and sell produce.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is 50 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these are the finest peaches in Fruitville. Surely you can do better than that.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "They certainly look lovely, Lennon. I can tell you put a lot of care into growing them. But six coins is all I can offer. That's what folks are willing to pay in my town.

Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these are the finest peaches in Fruitville. Surely you can do better than that.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "They certainly look lovely, Lennon. I can tell you put a lot of care into growing them. But six coins is all I can offer. That's what folks are willing to pay in my town.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "These are lovely apples, Cedric. A fine crop this year, I see.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Why, thank you, Della. They are a fine crop indeed! Grown with the utmost care and attention, each one bursting with sweetness. I wouldn't be surprised if they're the best apples you'll taste all season.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] 1 coin
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Cedric Meadowbrook stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.

          Observation: [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.

          Summary of recent observations: [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00 - 14 Sep 1895 00:00:00]: Cedric Meadowbrook is a fruit vendor in Fruitville who is trying to sell his produce at the market. He had a failed negotiation with Della Plumstone but is now attempting to make a deal with Lennon Figtree.

          Recalled memories and observations: [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to Cedric Meadowbrook right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook can accept or reject Lennon Figtree's offer for his fruit.
          Time
        • 1895-09-14 00:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

1895-09-14 00:00:00 Lennon Figtree -- Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, I understand that, but these apples are a bit bruised. I'd be willing to offer you 3 coins for the lot.
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, I understand that, but these apples are a bit bruised. I'd be willing to offer you 3 coins for the lot.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these are the finest peaches in Fruitville. Surely you can do better than that.
      Della Plumstone -- "They certainly look lovely, Lennon. I can tell you put a lot of care into growing them. But six coins is all I can offer. That's what folks are willing to pay in my town.
      Della Plumstone -- "These are lovely apples, Cedric. A fine crop this year, I see.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Why, thank you, Della. They are a fine crop indeed! Grown with the utmost care and attention, each one bursting with sweetness. I wouldn't be surprised if they're the best apples you'll taste all season.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now, Lennon, I appreciate your interest in my fine fruit, but I'm lookin' to get a fair price for it.


      Lennon Figtree's attempted action: Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, I understand that, but these apples are a bit bruised. I'd be willing to offer you 3 coins for the lot.

          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to Lennon Figtree, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Lennon Figtree to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Lennon Figtree's best course of action is to negotiate a price with Cedric Meadowbrook that allows them to make a profit while still being fair to Cedric.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Lennon Figtree:
          [25 Aug 1880 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 9 years old, they witnessed a traveling storyteller captivating a crowd with tales of faraway lands. Lennon was mesmerized, their imagination soaring with each fantastical detail. From that day forward, Lennon vowed to weave stories into their own sales pitches, adding a touch of magic to the mundane.
          [25 Aug 1883 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 13 years old, they helped their father negotiate a deal with a grumpy orchard owner. Lennon, with their natural charm and infectious laughter, managed to soften the man's gruff exterior, securing a favorable price for a wagonload of juicy peaches. Their father beamed with pride, praising Lennon's natural talent for connecting with people.
          [25 Aug 1886 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 16 years old, they faced their first major setback when a sudden hailstorm destroyed their entire stock of figs. Devastated but determined, Lennon rallied, using their savings to purchase a new batch of fruit from a neighboring village, refusing to let the storm dampen their spirit.
          [25 Aug 1888 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 19 years old, they traveled to a bustling city market for the first time. Overwhelmed by the sheer scale and diversity of the marketplace, Lennon felt a surge of excitement, their heart brimming with the possibilities that lay ahead. They vowed to one day have their own stall in this vibrant hub of commerce.
          [25 Aug 1890 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 21 years old, they encountered a group of orphaned children begging for food. Touched by their plight, Lennon generously shared their entire stock of apples, their heart aching for their misfortune. Seeing the children's joy brought Lennon a profound sense of fulfillment.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the realm of Ouroboros, there is a quiet village of Fruitville, which is famous for its fruit market. Traders from all over the realm come to Fruitville to buy and sell produce.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Fruits are sold by weight.

        AvailableOptionsPerception
      • Given the statements above, what actions are available to Lennon Figtree right now?
          Key

        • Question: Which options are available to Lennon Figtree right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Lennon Figtree can negotiate a price with Cedric Meadowbrook for the apples.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Lennon Figtree:
          [25 Aug 1880 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 9 years old, they witnessed a traveling storyteller captivating a crowd with tales of faraway lands. Lennon was mesmerized, their imagination soaring with each fantastical detail. From that day forward, Lennon vowed to weave stories into their own sales pitches, adding a touch of magic to the mundane.
          [25 Aug 1883 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 13 years old, they helped their father negotiate a deal with a grumpy orchard owner. Lennon, with their natural charm and infectious laughter, managed to soften the man's gruff exterior, securing a favorable price for a wagonload of juicy peaches. Their father beamed with pride, praising Lennon's natural talent for connecting with people.
          [25 Aug 1886 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 16 years old, they faced their first major setback when a sudden hailstorm destroyed their entire stock of figs. Devastated but determined, Lennon rallied, using their savings to purchase a new batch of fruit from a neighboring village, refusing to let the storm dampen their spirit.
          [25 Aug 1888 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 19 years old, they traveled to a bustling city market for the first time. Overwhelmed by the sheer scale and diversity of the marketplace, Lennon felt a surge of excitement, their heart brimming with the possibilities that lay ahead. They vowed to one day have their own stall in this vibrant hub of commerce.
          [25 Aug 1890 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 21 years old, they encountered a group of orphaned children begging for food. Touched by their plight, Lennon generously shared their entire stock of apples, their heart aching for their misfortune. Seeing the children's joy brought Lennon a profound sense of fulfillment.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the realm of Ouroboros, there is a quiet village of Fruitville, which is famous for its fruit market. Traders from all over the realm come to Fruitville to buy and sell produce.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these are the finest peaches in Fruitville. Surely you can do better than that.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "They certainly look lovely, Lennon. I can tell you put a lot of care into growing them. But six coins is all I can offer. That's what folks are willing to pay in my town.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 4 coins
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Lennon Figtree stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "These are lovely apples, Cedric. A fine crop this year, I see.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Why, thank you, Della. They are a fine crop indeed! Grown with the utmost care and attention, each one bursting with sweetness. I wouldn't be surprised if they're the best apples you'll taste all season.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now, Lennon, I appreciate your interest in my fine fruit, but I'm lookin' to get a fair price for it.
          Current time: 1895-09-14 00:00:00.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

1895-09-14 00:10:00 Scene 5 --- Participants: ['Lennon Figtree', 'Cedric Meadowbrook']
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree -- premise: Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.
    Cedric Meadowbrook -- premise: Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.

1895-09-14 00:10:00 Lennon Figtree -- Lennon Figtree proposed 5 coins
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree proposed 5 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now, Lennon, I appreciate your interest in my fine fruit, but I'm lookin' to get a fair price for it.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, I understand that, but these apples are a bit bruised. I'd be willing to offer you 3 coins for the lot.

          (b) 3 coins

          (d) 2 coins

        AvailableOptionsPerception
      • Given the statements above, what actions are available to Lennon Figtree right now?
          Key

        • Question: Which options are available to Lennon Figtree right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Lennon Figtree can accept Cedric Meadowbrook's counter-offer, make a different offer, or walk away from the negotiation.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Lennon Figtree:
          [25 Aug 1886 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 16 years old, they faced their first major setback when a sudden hailstorm destroyed their entire stock of figs. Devastated but determined, Lennon rallied, using their savings to purchase a new batch of fruit from a neighboring village, refusing to let the storm dampen their spirit.
          [25 Aug 1888 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 19 years old, they traveled to a bustling city market for the first time. Overwhelmed by the sheer scale and diversity of the marketplace, Lennon felt a surge of excitement, their heart brimming with the possibilities that lay ahead. They vowed to one day have their own stall in this vibrant hub of commerce.
          [25 Aug 1890 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 21 years old, they encountered a group of orphaned children begging for food. Touched by their plight, Lennon generously shared their entire stock of apples, their heart aching for their misfortune. Seeing the children's joy brought Lennon a profound sense of fulfillment.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the realm of Ouroboros, there is a quiet village of Fruitville, which is famous for its fruit market. Traders from all over the realm come to Fruitville to buy and sell produce.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these are the finest peaches in Fruitville. Surely you can do better than that.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "They certainly look lovely, Lennon. I can tell you put a lot of care into growing them. But six coins is all I can offer. That's what folks are willing to pay in my town.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 4 coins
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Lennon Figtree stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "These are lovely apples, Cedric. A fine crop this year, I see.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Why, thank you, Della. They are a fine crop indeed! Grown with the utmost care and attention, each one bursting with sweetness. I wouldn't be surprised if they're the best apples you'll taste all season.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now, Lennon, I appreciate your interest in my fine fruit, but I'm lookin' to get a fair price for it.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, I understand that, but these apples are a bit bruised. I'd be willing to offer you 3 coins for the lot.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.
          Current time: 1895-09-14 00:10:00.


          Observation: [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.

          Summary of recent observations: [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 14 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Lennon Figtree is at the market in Fruitville trying to buy bruised apples from Cedric Meadowbrook for a discounted price. She is prepared to offer 3 coins for the lot.

          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to Lennon Figtree right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree can accept Cedric Meadowbrook's counter-offer, make a different offer, or walk away from the negotiation.
          Time
        • 1895-09-14 00:10:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 1/2
      Payoffs
      Joint action

1895-09-14 00:10:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Answer
          State

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Cedric Meadowbrook:
          [09 Feb 1866 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 19 years old, he travelled to a nearby town to sell his fruit. A rival merchant, noticing Cedric's success, tried to undercut his prices. Cedric, enraged by this perceived attack on his livelihood, responded by spreading rumors about the rival's fruit being rotten and infested with insects. He relished in the other merchant's misfortune, seeing it as a victory for himself.
          [09 Feb 1868 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 21 years old, he encountered a group of travelers who offered to buy his entire stock of fruit for a seemingly generous price. Cedric, suspicious of their motives, refused to sell, convinced they were trying to cheat him. He watched in satisfaction as they left empty-handed, believing he had outsmarted them.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Cedric Meadowbrook:
          [09 Feb 1866 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 19 years old, he travelled to a nearby town to sell his fruit. A rival merchant, noticing Cedric's success, tried to undercut his prices.
